business.headline: Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta on why your portfolio should be yours, not someone else'sBuilding your investment portfolio should match your own risk comfort, timeframe and goals. What works for your friend may not work for you, says MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, Radhika Gupta.

Why your tax refund may be delayed this yearOne big reason for the delay is that the tax filing season began late this year. Normally, people can file their returns from April onwards. But this time, the Income Tax Department released the ITR utilities quite late.
Sensex down 400 points: Why is stock market falling todayAs of 11:50 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down by 388.85 points to 82,111.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 110.85 points to 25,039.00.

Only 6.7% filed ITRs: CoinSwitch co-founder on why Indians delay tax filingIndia has made big progress in digital tax filing over the years. There are new portals, better forms and more ways to pay taxes online. Yet, millions still wait till the last few days to get their documents in order.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares gained 5% todayOla Electric share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 43.60 before trading 5.45% higher at Rs 41.99 around 11:11 am, shortly after the electric two-wheeler maker announced its financial results for the first quarter of FY26.

Bitcoin zooms past $120,000 to reach all-time high. Here's whyThe world's largest cryptocurrency was last seen trading at $120,700.54, up 1.32%, as investor confidence remained strong ahead of important regulatory discussions in the United States.
Sensex, Nifty start week in red as IT stocks drag markets lower againThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 266.34 points to 82,234.13, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 67.95 points to 25,081.90 as of 9:22 am.

Travel Food Services to make market debut today; here's the latest GMPTravel Food Services listing: The grey market premium (GMP), which had dropped sharply in the past week, has seen a slight rise ahead of the listing.

Jane Street deposits Rs 4,843.5 crore, set to return to Dalal Street: ReportIn its interim order, Sebi had accused Jane Street of using manipulative strategies in Indian stock markets. The regulator directed the firm to deposit alleged unlawful gains in an escrow account with a scheduled commercial bank in India.

Why claiming your PF money seems so difficultIt all starts with tiny mistakes. A spelling error in your name, a mismatch in your date of birth, or an old bank account number can be enough to freeze your claim.

Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

entertainment.headline: Kota Srinivasa Rao: From bank desk to big screen, a career spanning 750 filmsKota Srinivasa Rao was more than just a character actor. From a bank job to over 750 films and a brief political stint, his journey was one of dedication, honesty, and depth.

Kangana Ranaut says MPs are disrespected, work with less budget than MLAsKangana Ranaut highlighted the lack of respect and budget constraints faced by MPs. She described them as being 'nowhere' and welcomed the DISHA initiative as a step forward.

Preity Zinta, Neena and Masaba Gupta attend Wimbledon Final in London. See picsActor Preity Zinta and her husband Gene Goodenough attended the Wimbledon final in London. Neena Gupta and her daughter Masaba were also seen at the event. They shared photos from the thrilling tennis event on Instagram.

The Revolutionaries first look: Nikkhil Advani recreates Indian freedom struggleThe first look of Prime Video's 'The Revolutionaries' was recently unveiled. The Nikkhil Advani directorial is based on the Indian freedom struggle against British rule.

Ram Gopal Varma says media exaggerated Deepika Padukone vs Sandeep Vanga issueRam Gopal Varma says fixed working hours is a conversation that has to happen between a director and an actor, and the media exaggerated the entire Deepika Padukone-Sandeep Reddy Vanga issue.

Karan Johar's daughter Roohi joins labubu trend: It's not a trend, it's my friendKaran Johar shared a cute video of his daughter Roohi confidently calling her Labubu doll a 'friend', not just a trend, winning hearts online. The video went viral, with fans and celebrities showering love on Roohi's adorable response.

Emotional Jr NTR meets Kota Srinivasa Rao's family, asks them to not chant Jai NTRJr NTR visited Kota Srinivasa Rao's family to offer condolences and called his death an 'irreplaceable loss' to Telugu cinema. He urged fans to celebrate the legendary actor's legacy through his performances, saying, "There is only one like him."

Rajinikanth mourns Saroja Devi's death: The great actress who won million heartsRenowned South Indian actor B Saroja Devi has died at 87 due to age-related ailments. Superstar Rajinikanth paid his last respects to the actor on X.

Lollapalooza Berlin: J-hope owns the stage and delivers as BTS was watchingBTS member J-Hope rocked the stage in Berlin at the Lollapalooza festival. Meanwhile, his fellow band members tuned in live on Weverse to show their support. Find out which members joined the online concert.

Rajeev Khandelwal recalls quitting Kahiin Toh Hoga, choosing quality over moneyActor Rajeev Khandelwal recently opened up on the perception around him after he quit Ektaa Kapoor's 'Kahiin To Hoga' (2003-2005). He mentioned the negative articles written about him at that time.

Legendary South actor B Saroja Devi dies at 87B Saroja Devi, one of South Indian cinema's most iconic and beloved female actors, died at 87. Known for her memorable roles across Tamil, Telugu, and Kannada films, she was a towering figure in Indian cinema for over six decades.

Superman box office day 3: James Gunn's film flies high, crushes 1st weekend numbers'Superman' rocked a fabulous first weekend at the Indian box office. The James Gunn-directorial has impressed the Indian audience, and is looking at recording a good first week.

Urvashi Rautela carries labubus to Wimbledon, internet can't stop laughingUrvashi Rautela's photos from Wimbledon 2025 went viral after she carried four Labubu dolls to the match while wearing a white gown. Fans on social media shared funny comments and memes about her unique look.

Metro In Dino box office Day 10: Anurag Basu's monsoon romantic drama wins all overMetro... In Dino remained steady during weekdays, and performed decently well during its second weekend at the box office. The film has also surpassed the new Bollywood releases.

SS Rajamouli pushes fan trying for selfie at Kota Srinivasa Rao's funeral. VideoA video of SS Rajamouli pushing away a fan trying to click a selfie during veteran actor Kota Srinivasa Rao's funeral in Hyderabad has gone viral. The farewell was also attended by several Tollywood actors.

Actor Silambarasan sheds 10 kg in 10 days for Vetri Maaran's upcoming filmSilambarasan TR, known as STR, has undergone significant weight loss for his role in Vetri Maaran's new film. He reportedly lost around 10 kilograms in 10 days to play a youthful version in the film.

R Madhavan addresses Hindi-Marathi debate, says never faced any problemActor R Madhavan shared his views on the Hindi-Marathi language row. He shared his personal experience and said he never faced any problems because of language.

Stuntman dies during shoot of Pa Ranjith-Arya film, actor Vishal pays tributeStuntman Raju died while performing a car stunt on the sets of an upcoming Kollywood film. The film features actor Arya and is being directed by Pa Ranjith. Actor Vishal paid tribute to Raju on X.

Aamir met Riteish, asked if I was working: Genelia on how she was cast in SitaareActor Genelia Deshmukh discussed how she was cast for 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. She said it was actor Aamir Khan who met her husband Riteish Deshmukh and enquired whether she was working.

general news.headline: Nothing much government can do: Centre on Nimisha Priya's execution in YemenThe government told the Supreme Court that it has exhausted all diplomatic options to secure the release or prevent the execution of Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya in Yemen.

No mechanical faults found in crashed plane: Air India CEO on probe reportAir India CEO Campbell Wilson also pointed out that both pilots had cleared mandatory pre-flight breath analyser tests, and that the AAIB report made no observations related to their medical status.

Video: Omar Abdullah scales wall to reach Martyrs' Graveyard day after 'house arrest'Chief Minister Omar Abdullah climbed a railing along with his cabinet ministers to visit the Martyrs' Graveyard in Nowhatta and pay floral tributes. On Sunday, several leaders from the ruling National Conference Party were put under house arrest in a bid to stop them from marking Martyrs' Day today.

LIVE: Shubhanshu Shukla to enter Dragon with Ax-4 crew shortlyAxiom 4 Mission Return Live Updates: Commander Peggy Whitson from the USA, Sawosz Uznaski-Winiewski from Poland, Tibor Kapu from Hungary, India's Shubhanshu Shukla will undock from the Space Station to begin their return journey to Earth. They will take 21 hours to re-enter Earth's atmosphere and splashdown on Tuesday.

Yesterday's coffee is today's coffee: What it takes to survive at Space Station  UNDOCKING LIVEGrabbing the morning-coffee mug is muscle memory on Earth. But at the International Space Station (ISS), even that's a feat of science and improvisation. With Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla set to return from the ISS after 18 days, here's a peek into the strange, disciplined, and ingenious life 400 km above Earth.

England vs India: Mohammed Siraj fined for Ben Duckett send-off in Lord's TestIndia fast bowler Mohammed Siraj was fined 15 percent of his match fee for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the fourth day of the third Test against England at Lord's on Sunday.

No breach of privacy: Supreme Court allows secret call recordings in divorce casesA bench comprising Justice BV Nagarathna and Justice Satish Chandra Sharma held that such secretly recorded conversations are, in fact, admissible evidence in matrimonial disputes.
Still no maturity in him: Top court directs cartoonist to apologise for PM postsStill no maturity in him: Supreme Court blasts cartoonist arrested over 'inflammatory' posts on PM, RSS

Can India chase 193 at Lord's? Here's what history suggestsEngland vs India: India bowled England out for 192 on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's. Washington Sundar's impressive four-wicket haul was key in restricting England on a challenging pitch.

Former Miss Puducherry who spoke against colourism dies by suicideModel and pageant winner San Rechal Gandhi, who challenged colourism and advocated for women's safety, passed away in Puducherry after a reported overdose of sleeping pills. She had represented India in several international modelling events.

Flee Mamdani's tyranny: Vivek Ramaswamy supporters begin billboard battle in NYA Times Square billboard, funded by a pro-Vivek Ramaswamy group, urges New Yorkers to "flee" Zohran Mamdani's "socialist tyranny" and move to Ohio. Ramaswamy, a Republican leader, is promoting Ohio as a "freer, more prosperous alternative" to New York.

Packaged food alert: Why India needs warning labels, not health star ratingsExperts share how the country's draft guidelines on food labelling require more democratic dialogue in order to truly empower the consumer

Is China's rare-earth weaponisation giving India a rare chance?China, the biggest holder of rare earths, is weaponising them by restricting the supply. Though it has hit the EV industry in India, will the country, which possesses the third-biggest reserve of rare earths, be able to use this as a rare opportunity?

Air India replaced crashed plane's fuel switch unit twiceAir India replaced the critical throttle control module, which includes the fuel control switches, twice on the Boeing 787 before it crashed. The investigation continues into what caused the fuel cutoff switches to activate during takeoff.

Saina Nehwal announces separation from Parupalli Kashyap after 7 years of marriageBadminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have decided to separate after nearly 7 years of marriage. Saina announced her decision in an Instagram post on Sunday, July 13.

How Brad Pitt's Tangaliya shirt in 'F1' movie spotlights a 700-year-old Indian craftPitt's onscreen character has put Tangaliya's handwoven artistry on the global stage, but can the attention help revive a fading tradition?

Does eating rice cause belly fat or weight gain? Nutritionist explainsRice is often blamed for causing weight gain but Dr Manjari Chandra, a functional nutritionist, says overeating and lifestyle are the real causes. Understanding portion sizes and balanced meals is essential to avoiding fat storage.

Plane crashes moments after takeoff at London airport, turns into fireballThe crash led to the cancellation of at least four scheduled flights on Sunday afternoon, according to the airport's website. Authorities have not yet disclosed how many people were on board the aircraft or their condition.

Pune cafe's license suspended after customer finds glass in bun, shares videoA video of a man finding a piece of glass in a bun muska at Pune's Cafe Goodluck went viral, prompting the FDA to suspend the eatery's licence over hygiene concerns.

Why be ashamed of Hindi? Pawan Kalyan asks people amid language imposition rowAndhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan urged people to overcome hesitation towards Hindi. He said Hindi is a unifying one that connects hearts across India, like English does.

Nude deepfakes shared by Trinamool cadres: Suspended student leader's big chargeThis development comes just days after the student leader Rajanya Haldar, appearing on a local TV show, condemned the gangrape of a first-year law college student in Kolkata. She claimed that such misogynistic attitudes are prevalent among a certain section of student leaders.

Indian Railways passenger regrets being kind as group refuses to vacate his seatA man's train ride to Ujjain turned sour after a group refused to vacate his berth. He narrated his ordeal in a now-viral post on Reddit.

sports.headline: Day 5 Live Score: Can India conquer Lord's again?India (IND) vs England (ENG), 3rd Test, Day 5 Live Score: After a gripping Day Four at Lord's on Sunday, the third Test between India and England remains finely balanced. Chasing 193, India suffered a mini-collapse, losing four wickets. However, the visitors will look to regroup and chase the remaining 135 runs with six wickets in hand.

Watch: Sinner, Swiatek share awkward dance at Wimbledon Champions' ballFrom Centre Court to centre stage, Wimbledon 2025 champions Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek dazzled not just with their rackets but with their rhythm, lighting up the Champions' Dinner in style.

Club World Cup may be more important than Champions League in future: MarescaChelsea head coach Enzo Maresca made headlines after his team's 3-0 win over Paris Saint-Germain in the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup final, calling the title a global triumph and claiming the competition now rivals - or even surpasses - the Champions League in prestige.

KL Rahul will be the main man if India are to win Lord's Test, says KumbleAnil Kumble suggested that KL Rahul would have to lead India's chase and bat till the end to ensure that the visitors come out victorious in the Lord's Test to take a 2-1 series lead.

Hussain backs KL Rahul and Pant to lead India to historic Lord's winFormer England captain Nasser Hussain believes that the partnership between KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant could be key to India's chances of winning the Lord's Test. With six wickets in hand, India need 135 more runs to take a 2-1 lead in the five-match Test series at Lord's.

MI New York clinch thriller vs Washington Freedom to secure second titleMI New York held its nerve in a tense finish to defeat Washington Freedom by five runs and claim its second Major League Cricket (MLC) title at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 14, 2025.

Luis Enrique rues scuffle at CWC final: Situation could've been avoidedLuis Enrique admitted that the on-field scuffle between PSG and Chelsea could have been avoided. The incident took place at the FIFA Club World Cup final, where Chelsea came out victorious with a crushing 3-1 win.

Jannik Sinner breaks the Carlos Alcaraz barrier with lessons from the pastWimbledon 2025: World No.1 Jannik Sinner made a stupendous recovery from his French Open loss to Carlos Alcaraz and beat the Spaniard on Sunday at the All England Club.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
